chunks.text: Welcome to cloud computing with AWS. Amazon Web Services is the leading cloud platform offering over 200 services.
Cloud computing provides on-demand resources without managing physical infrastructure. It offers scalability, reliability, and cost-effectiveness.
EC2, Elastic Compute Cloud, provides virtual servers in the cloud. You can choose instance types based on your needs.
S3, Simple Storage Service, offers object storage with high durability. It's perfect for backups, static websites, and data archiving.
RDS, Relational Database Service, manages databases like MySQL, PostgreSQL, and Oracle without server management.
Lambda enables serverless computing, running code without provisioning servers. You pay only for compute time used.
VPC, Virtual Private Cloud, lets you create isolated networks in AWS. Security groups and NACLs control traffic.
CloudFormation provides infrastructure as code, allowing you to define resources in JSON or YAML templates.
IAM, Identity and Access Management, controls who can access AWS resources. Follow the principle of least privilege.
CloudWatch monitors AWS resources and applications. It provides metrics, logs, and alarms for operational health.
Cost optimization strategies include using reserved instances, spot instances, and right-sizing resources.
This overview covered key AWS services. Hands-on practice and AWS certification can deepen your cloud expertise.
